Brief Summary:
To test whether increasing the dose of imatinib or combining it with IFNalpha or ara-C increases the rate of molecular response (as measured by the decrease in BCR-ABL transcripts after 12 months of treatment) in patients with previously untreated CML in chronic phase.

To compare overall survival in a selected arm according to molecular response at 1 year from randomization with the reference arm.
Interventions: DRUG: Imatinib mesylate 400 mg|DRUG: Imatinib mesylate 600 mg|DRUG: Imatinib 400 mg + Peg-Interferon|DRUG: Imatinib mesylate 400 mg + Cytarabine
Secondary Outcome Measures: Molecular response improvement at 1 year, 1 year|Hematological, cytogenetic responses improvement, 1 year|Duration of responses improvement|Survival without progression improvement|Acceptable toxicity
Collaborators: Ministry of Health, France|Novartis|Roche Pharma AG
Study Design: Allocation: RANDOMIZED|Intervention Model: PARALLEL|Masking: NONE|Primary Purpose: TREATMENT
